meanings.sent1: She always preapplies sunscreen before going to the beach.
meanings.sent2: He preapplies for jobs to increase his chances of getting hired.
meanings.sent3: The student preapplies glue to the paper, but then changes his mind.
meanings.sent4: The chef preapplies seasoning to the meat, ensuring a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent5: Preapplying insect repellent can prevent bug bites during outdoor activities.

meanings.sent1: Before submitting the final form, she preapplies online.
meanings.sent2: He preapplies for the scholarship to secure financial aid.
meanings.sent3: The team preapplies for the tournament, eager to compete.
meanings.sent4: She preapplies for the loan, hoping for quick approval.
meanings.sent5: Preapplying for the membership saves time at the registration desk.

meanings.definition: To put into effect in advance
meanings.sent1: The company preapplies safety measures to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: He preapplies the new policy to streamline the process.
meanings.sent3: The teacher preapplies the lesson plan for the upcoming week.
meanings.sent4: She preapplies the discount code to enjoy savings on her purchase.
meanings.sent5: Preapplying strategies can lead to better outcomes in challenging situations.
